content: feather stitch scarf by kath hewitt thank you for purchasing a raw hook crochet designs pattern i hope you find it easy to follow and enjoy making your scarf feel free to share yours in my facebook group https //www facebook com/groups/therawhookersclub/ ref=group_header or on instagram https //www instagram com/rawhook/ you can also contact me through ravelry or via email using khewitt261@yahoo co uk materials needed you can use any hook and yarn to make your scarf i used a 6mm hook and almost 400m of b&m s chunky green tweed yarn my scarf measures approx 6 wide x 63 5 long the sample in the instructions was with a 5mm hook and women s institute aran in plum the approx width is 5 stitches and abbreviations us terms chain chain chain-space chain space half_double_crochet half_double_crochet feather stitch no abbreviation pattern notes pattern is worked in row ch1 turning chain does not count as a stitch throughout the pattern the first half_double_crochet of each row will be worked into the same space as the turning chain special stitches feather stitch the pattern repeat for this stitch is 2+1 and then add your turning chain there are four row to start the pattern then row 4 is repeated until the desired length is achieved chain 17 +1 1 half_double_crochet in the 2nd chain from the hook continue to half_double_crochet to the end of the row 17hdc turn ch1 2 half_double_crochet in the first stitch same space as turning chain *ch1 sk1 hdc1* to the end of the row you will end with a half_double_crochet in the last stitch 9hdc/8ch-space ch1 turn 3 half_double_crochet in the first stitch now you will make the first feather yo insert your hook into the 1st chain space of the row below yo again and draw the loop through 3 loops on your hook yo insert your hook into the skipped stitch 2 row below yo again and draw the loop through 5 loops on your hook yo insert your hook into the next chain-space of the row below draw the loop through 7 loops on your hook yo and draw through all 7 loops on hook ch1 to close the stitch that is the first feather stitch complete the next feather is worked in the same place the last one finished *yo insert your hook into the same chain space that your last feather ended yo again and draw the loop through 3 loops on your hook yo insert your hook into the skipped stitch 2 row below yo again and draw the loop through 5 loops on your hook yo insert your hook into the next chain-space of the row below yo draw the loop through 7 loops on your hook yo and draw through all 7 loops on hook ch1 to close the stitch * repeat between *to the end of the row use the pictures to help you see where to work the last feather half_double_crochet in the last stitch you should
